snippet: Scott M. Stringer, New York City Comptroller, says government and business should help Americans achieve a better work-home balance.
abstract: Letter from New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer comments on July 16 article about growing national movement seeking to curb workplace scheduling practices that impose part-time work or unpredictable schedules on employees.
lead_paragraph: Scott M. Stringer, New York City Comptroller, says government and business should help Americans achieve a better work-home balance.
